comment: Weekly readings with assessments on the papers that we read. Midterms and final was rather large with page requirements and citations. Decently difficult and while it was OK I probably wouldn't take it again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: No textbook: 2-3 research journals per week. Weekly quizzes, discussions, and MC/essay question midterm and final (open-book), and easy 7-8 pg. research paper if you plan ahead. Prof VZ responds promptly, is supportive, and an easy grader (adds EC to exams). Content is actually interesting and thought-provoking! Easy A, would definitely recommend.

Seems that a lot of people dont like him because they failed to read the instructions or didnt follow them. Only assignments are weekly discuissions that are pulled right from the book, final/midterm and a project he made optional. Read the syllabus and put a tiny amount of effort and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: You would be better off taking another professor. Although there is a grading outline in the syllabus, you can initially expect to get a lower grade based off of criteria that is not posted in the syllabus. Other than that, there are 200-word long weekly discussions, a midterm and a final where students pick questions and write a page on them.
